intro: Boerhavia albiflora var. heronensis, commonly known as the Heron's beard, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are usually opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry fields. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
